quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Clip and Audio Clip
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, horse, rated. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: I have claws, fur and a tail.  I like to live with people and come from a family called Felidae.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cat

questions.question: Which 1987 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Planes, Trains, and Automobiles

questions.question: I have eight legs and I live in the water.  I am very strong.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octopus

questions.question: Which 1991 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Silence of the Lambs

questions.question: Which 1999 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Matrix

questions.question: I am small, grey and I eat cheese.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mouse

questions.question: I have a pouch and I carry my baby in it.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kangaroo

questions.question: Which 1993 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tombstone

questions.question: Which 1986 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Platoon

questions.question: I am a cousin of the horse.  I run fast and have stripes on my fur.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zebra

questions.question: Which 1998 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Waterboy

questions.question: Which 1997 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liar Liar

questions.question: Which 1994 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dumb and Dumber

questions.question: Which 1983 movie is this audio clip from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarface

questions.question: Which 1980 movie is this audio clip from?

options.text: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Airplane!

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Tolkien and Night
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, tolkien, gravestone. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The name of this fictional character was engraved on the gravestone of J. R. R. Tolkien in Oxford.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beren

questions.question: Writer J. R. R. Tolkien was born on January 3, 1892 in which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: In 2003, BBC viewers voted in a survey  called The Big Read to choose the Nations Best-loved Book.  What number did Tolkiens The Lord of the Rings reach on the list?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Number 1

questions.question: I am the only mammal that can fly.  I hang upside down and come out at night.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bat

questions.question: I am an insect, I have very pretty wings.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Butterfly

questions.question: I hop, I swim and I eat flies.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frog

questions.question: Which fantasy book by J. R. R. Tolkien, often regarded as a childrens story,  was not published posthumously?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hobbit

questions.question: Which of the following literary works was not written by J. R. R. Tolkien?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chronicles of Narnia

questions.question: I am the fastest animal on Earth.  I can run reach speeds of 70 mph (110 km/h).  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheetah

questions.question: What is the full name of the famous British writer J. R. R. Tolkien, author of the trilogy The Lord of the Rings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien

questions.question: This word was invented by Tolkien and was subsequently used as an informal name of an extinct human species, discovered in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hobbit

questions.question: I am a fish, I have a long mouth and I eat other fish.  I come out at night.  What am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barracuda

questions.question: Writer J. R. R. Tolkien served in the British army during which war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War I

questions.question: J. R. R. Tolkien was religious and insisted that his wife convert to his faith. What was the religion he was devoted to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catholicism

questions.question: J. R. R. Tolkien invented several artificial languages for the characters of his books. What was the name of the Elvish language, based on Greek, Finnish and Latin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quenya

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Religion and Maryland
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, maryland. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This former Major League Baseball player was the first pitcher to win a World Series game in three different decades.

options.text: Roger Clemens of the Red Sox

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Palmer of the Orioles

questions.question: Which former Governor of Maryland attacked his political opponents with the phrase, Nattering nabobs of negativism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spiro Agnew

questions.question: This programming language was invented by Grace Murray Hopper, who in 1973 became the first person from the United States and the first woman of any nationality, to be made a Distinguished Fellow of the British Computer Society.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: COBOL

questions.question: This US President was forced to give an interview to Anne Royall, the first female professional journalist in the USA, after she learned that he liked skinny-dipping in the Potomac River.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: This actress and socialite, born in Budapest, Hungary, appeared as dancer Jane Avril in Moulin Rouge (1952).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zsa Zsa Gabor

questions.question: Buster Keaton, famous for the deadpan expression on his face, was an influential silent-film comic actor. Who gave him the nickname, Buster?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Houdini

questions.question: This highly symbolic novella, written by Franz Kafka tells the story of a man, who wakes up to find himself transformed into a giant insect-like creature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Metamorphosis

questions.question: This scientist, author of the non-fiction book, Three Steps to Victory, contributed considerably to the development of the radar, which became an important tool in warfare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Watson-Watt

questions.question: This company, founded in Long Island in 1972  by Hyman Golden, Arnold Greenberg and Leonard Marsh, initially offered only carbonated apple soda.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snapple

questions.question: On October 2, 1942 this enormous ocean liner collided with the light cruiser Curacoa, splitting the ship in half.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Mary

questions.question: This singer won an Emmy Award for her performance on the penultimate episode of The Tonight Show in May 1992, during which she sang an emotional song,One for My Baby (and One More for the Road), to host Johnny Carson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Midler

questions.question: Which definition refers to the word chisenbop, which is believed to be of Korean origin?

options.text: An Asian delicacy made of snails surrounded by lobster meat.
A method of using the fingers to perform mathematical operations.
The name of the lunar calendar used in Korea and parts of northeastern China.
An Asian species of orchid found only in the far southeastern part of China.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A method of using the fingers to perform mathematical operations.

questions.question: According to this religion, which originated in the pre-history of South Asia, the universe was never created, nor will it ever cease to exist. One of the most important scriptures of this religion is Tattvartha Sutra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jainism

questions.question: Why did President John F. Kennedy choose to visit Dallas, Texas on November, 1963?

options.text: He wanted to raise funds for 1964 presidential election
He wanted to begin his quest for re-election
He wanted to mend political fences among several leading Texas Democratic Party members

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In 1929, the two cousins, Frederick Dannay and Manfred B. Lee, began writing detective fiction under what pseudonym?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellery Queen

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Movie and Reese Witherspoon
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This character, portrayed by Reese Witherspoon in the 2002 movie Sweet Home Alabama is a New York City fashion designer who suddenly finds herself engaged to the citys most eligible bachelor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Melanie Smooter

questions.question: Reese Witherspoon, who portrays June Carter Cash in the box office hit Walk the Line, did her own singing in the movie and played what instrument?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auto-harp

questions.question: Actor Chuck Connors portrayed Lucas McCain on the television Western series, Rifleman. What  else did he do for a living ?

options.text: He was the original Marlboro Man.
He was a professional baseball and basketball player
He was a stuntman on TV shows

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a professional baseball and basketball player

questions.question: In this romantic comedy, Reese Witherspoon plays Elizabeth Masterson, a young workaholic doctor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Just Like Heaven

questions.question: Name the first artificial satellite, put in orbit on October 4 in 1957, which marked the beginning of the space race.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sputnik I

questions.question: One of Reeses ancestors, John Witherspoon, signed the Declaration of Independence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the birth name of actress Reese Witherspoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Laura Jean Reese Witherspoon

questions.question: What is the name of the fashion savvy character, portrayed by Reese Witherspoon in the 2001 movie Legally Blonde?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elle Woods

questions.question: This man is one of the greatest and most famous scientists of the 20th century.  In 1921 he received the Nobel Prize in physics. He left his native country right after Hitler came to power and went to the US.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: Following her high school graduation, Reese attended Stanford University. What was her major?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English Literature

questions.question: In the movie Legally Blonde, the main character, portrayed by Reese Witherspoon, has a chihuahua, whose name is what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruiser

questions.question: This Major League Baseball player for the Detroit Tigers was given the nickname, The Bird.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Fidrych

questions.question: Soon after getting engaged in 1998, Reese Witherspoon and Ryan Philippe, starred together in which movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cruel Intentions

questions.question: This art and architecture school was founded in 1919 in Weimar, Germany. Paul Klee and  Wassily Kandinsky were among the prominent artists who lectured there.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bauhaus

questions.question: Reese Witherspoon made her film debut, playing the 14- year-old tomboy, Danielle Trant, in which movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The man in the Moon

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Space and Actress
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, atlanta. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Argentinean was a radio and TV actress before she married Juan Per󮠩n 1945, who later became President of Argentina.  She had a foundation that supported the demands of the poor, orphaned children and womens rights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evita Peron

questions.question: The greatest myth about this person is that he invented the automobile. However, he was the man to enable mass production of automobiles. This became possible by the standardized interchangeable parts and assembly-line techniques.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Ford

questions.question: This lady started out as a serious actress but was famously known to play wisecracking career women, such as her character Hildy Johnson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosalind Russell

questions.question: He was the first Head of U.S.S.R. from 1917 to 1924 and the founder of the Russian Communist Party.  His body was embalmed and nowadays you can see it in his mausoleum on Red Square in Moscow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lenin

questions.question: This unparalleled actress was nominated eleven times for an Academy Award, but only won two of them. One of them was for her role in Dangerous.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Davis

questions.question: With glorious red hair and a striking figure, this Love Goddess was the World War ll pinup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Hayworth

questions.question: He was the first human to travel into space.  When he was in orbit he declared I dont see any god up here.  A crater on the far side of the Moon is named after him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yuri Gagarin

questions.question: This Russian leader received the Nobel Price on October 15, 1990 because of his role in loosening the Soviet hegemony over Eastern Europe effectively ending the Cold War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Gorbachev

questions.question: This African American man was born in Atlanta, Ga, USA.  He was a pivotal figure in the Civil Rights Movement.  One of his famous quotes is,  I have a dream....
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Luther King, Jr.

questions.question: Even though she was of the most popular and highly paid Hollywood actors of the 1930s, her image was risque and sultry.  In 1959 she wrote her autobiography, Goodness Had Nothing to Do with It.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mae West

questions.question: This great actor was born in a poor suburb of London.  Shortly after arriving in the US in 1910, he signed a $1,000,000 contract to play in a silent comedy series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Chaplin

questions.question: What stunning screen siren was married to three  famous men - Mickey Rooney, Artie Shaw, and Frank Sinatra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ava Gardner

questions.question: This Austrian neurologist was the founder of the psychoanalytic school. He made popular the idea of conscious versus unconscious and considered dream interpretation very important.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sigmund Freud

questions.question: He was the most famous artist in the world by the late 1930s.  This artist started expressing space in a strongly geometrical way; which led to the appearance of Cubism.  He attended the School of Fine Arts in Barcelona but he was first learned to paint from his father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Picasso

questions.question: One of the greatest entertainers of the 20th century, this one-time child star recorded nearly 100 singles and about a dozen albums.  Her 1955 album was titled Miss Show Business.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judy Garland

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Elephants and Film
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nowadays, crete. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Elephants are the only member of the group of animals known as Pachyderms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The African Elephant is an endangered species.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Born Lucille Fay LeSueur, studio chief Louis B. Mayer was unhappy with her name.  A contest in the fan magazine Movie Weekly was the source of her well-known stage name.  She won her only Oscar after being dropped by MGM and revived by Warner Bros.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Crawford

questions.question: There are only two remaining species of elephants in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Elephants can live to 70 plus years.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Asian Elephants are larger than African Elephants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Elephants are related to manatees.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Popular legend has it that she was discovered sitting on a fountain stool at Schwabs drugstore in Hollywood. She is well known for playing a lead role on a very risque, controversial book turned into film.  She was called Judy as a child.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lana Turner

questions.question: Elephants tusks can grow an entire foot (30 cm) each year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: An elephants trunk has over 40,000 individual muscles in it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tiny elephants once lived on the island of Crete.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mae is the first name of what American film legend and sex symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mae West

questions.question: This actress starred in almost a hundred films during her career and received four nominations for the Academy Award for Best Actress.  She received an Academy Honorary Award for superlative creativity and unique contribution to the art of screen acting in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbara Stanwyck

questions.question: This gorgeous movie actress - radiant and dark haired, received her only Oscar nomination for playing a neurotic bride in the film noir Leave Her to Heaven. (1945)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gene Tierney

questions.question: Nowadays there are nearly 1.3 million wild African Elephants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
